item.title: Emotes... Not working?

item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“The Mentor, post:18, topic:76033”]You could just use the emotes from the buttons. Search for… case 168 if I remember correctly that’s the “Yes” emote, change the animation thing to whatever you want.[/quote]I just said it’s not that my emotes won’t work, it’s that something is making my Server not let emotes work. So, I’ve got to figure out how to make the Emotes work again.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 07, 2007, 01:54:48 PM[/size][hr]Anyone know what could be wrong?

item.title: Emotes... Not working?
item.dc:creator: @The_Mentor The Mentor
item.description:
@The_Mentor wrote:

You could just use the emotes from the buttons. Search for… case 168 if I remember correctly that’s the “Yes” emote, change the animation thing to whatever you want.

item.title: Emotes... Not working?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“The Mentor, post:16, topic:76033”]Try this, I’m not sure that will this work.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bendover") && playerRights == 3) { if (actionTimer == 0) { startAnimation(1078); actionTimer = 14; } }[/quote]Thanks for trying, but I just noticed something… When I tried to do any of the emotes ON THE EMOTE PAGE they didn’t work. I don’t think it’s my emotes that are the problem, I think there’s something in my Server documents that are preventing the Emotes from working. Any idea’s on what could cause a problem like this?

Read full topic

item.title: Emotes... Not working?

@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“The Mentor, post:14, topic:76033”]You realize, that startAnimation just starts the emotes, meaning that once you started the emotes it won’t stop them.[/quote]I know… But are you helping? No… lol

item.title: Emotes... Not working?
item.dc:creator: @The_Mentor The Mentor
item.description:
@The_Mentor wrote:

You realize, that startAnimation just starts the emotes, meaning that once you started the emotes it won’t stop them.

Read full topic

item.title: Emotes... Not working?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Well… Here’s all of my emote commands… I don’t see what’s wrong with them is the problem… I have them under “tools” where commands go if it matters and I use PimpScape.

[code]
/* Emotes */

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“bendover”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(1078);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“adminglow”) && playerRights >= 2) {
startAnimation(1057);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rubself”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(1852);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“armscrossed”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(2256);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“sitdownwithhandovermouth”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(1353);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“jumpandbeproud”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(3423);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“kneel”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(3256);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“explosion”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(582);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“blacksparkles”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(576);
}

startAnimation(575);
}

}

}

}

}

startAnimation(189);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“boottoprivate”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(3001);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“bigcock”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(1770);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“funny”) && playerRights == 3) {

}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“funny4”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(1769);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“jog”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“sarah”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(2746);
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“pushup”) && playerRights == 3) {
startAnimation(2756);

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“situp”) && playerRights == 3) {
